poem:
Anaemic Growth

The quiet hum  
of stores,  
threadbare streets  
wrapped in the fog  
of tax and rule—  
a slow pulse  
of commerce,  
faint breaths  
held in the clutch  
of idle tills.  
Still, we weave  
our days,  
knitting dreams  
thin as mist  
yet persistent  
as the morning.
